text: July 14 2015 3 billion miles from Earth
NASA's new Horizons probe begins the
first flyby of Pluto we've seen images
of Pluto from Hubble from ground-based
telescopes but this is the first time
we're ever gonna see anything on the
surface the pictures reveal something
totally unexpected towering above the
Bleak landscape of ice
so we see Pluto has mountains big
mountains everybody is shocked no one
was expecting to find features quite
like this on Pluto we expect the surface
of Pluto to be much like the other icy
moons and planets a surface of ice with
a smattering of craters how wrong we
were the mysterious mountains are as
high as the Rockies a potential clue to
the mystery of the mountains comes from
images of a vast curiously flat plain
next to the giant Peaks one of the most
exotic surfaces on Pluto is Sputnik
Planum big white area expansive ice the
massive alien ice sheet is like nothing
we have on earth it's ice but not as we
know it what these images are showing is
frozen carbon dioxide methane and
nitrogen on the surface of Pluto that
could be moving similarly to how
glaciers move on earth
no one expected to see anything that
looks like glaciers on Pluto this is
fascinating
this frozen desert inspires a new theory
that glacial activity could have created
the mile-high mountains so we see this
big glacial system on Pluto could that
be causing the mountains
could it be carving out and leaving the
mountains behind him it's possible that
Pluto in the past has had glaciers
glaciers of nitrogen ice a much softer
more volatile ice than water and
actually just scoured these mountains
and made them look kind of like glacial
features look on the earth the theory so
far remains unproven for now
Pluto's mountains are still an enigma
